title: Comprehensive evaluation of the impact of whole-genome bisulfite sequencing (WGBS) on the fragmentomic characteristics of plasma cell-free DNA.
venue: Clinica chimica acta; international journal of clinical chemistry	 566	 120033.
excerpt: This paper systematically evaluated the impact of WGBS on cfDNA fragmentomic features compared to WGS	 offering insights for liquid biopsy applications. (*Co-first Author*)
citation: Li S.* Lin Y.* Su F.* et al. (2025). "Comprehensive evaluation of the impact of whole-genome bisulfite sequencing (WGBS) on the fragmentomic characteristics of plasma cell-free DNA." Clinica chimica acta; international journal of clinical chemistry 566 120033. (*Co-first Author SCI Q2*)

title: Wide-spectrum profiling of plasma cell-free RNA and the potential for health-monitoring.
excerpt: This study characterized the plasma cfRNA landscape and identified potential health monitoring biomarkers using a novel wide-spectrum sequencing method. (*Co-first Author*)
citation: Wang X.* Li S.* Ou R.* et al. (2025). "Wide-spectrum profiling of plasma cell-free RNA and the potential for health-monitoring." RNA biology 22(1) 1-15. (*Co-first Author SCI Q2*)

title: Shared genetic features inference among hypoxia-ischemia diseases in the presence of heterogenous omics data based on a novel risk assessment method.
excerpt: This research inferred shared genetic features among hypoxia-ischemia diseases by analyzing heterogeneous omics data using a novel risk assessment method. (CRediT: Formal Analysis)
citation: Zhang Y. Liu J. Basang Z. Yang Q. Chen S. Li S. Lei C. Fang M. Liu H. Jin X. & Wang Y. (2025). "Shared genetic features inference among hypoxia-ischemia diseases in the presence of heterogenous omics data based on a novel risk assessment method." Frontiers in Genetics 16 1587854. (CRediT: Formal Analysis SCI Q2 in press)
